bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Merritte W. Ireland, April 17-18, 1928

div1.p: Kean sends Ireland a letter from Frank McCoy concerning Gen. Summerall's statements about the roles played by Sternberg and Wood in the work of yellow fever commission. On the bottom of the letter, Ireland adds an expression of interest and his initials.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Merritte W. Ireland, April 17-18, 1928
div1.p:
I am sure that you will read this
letter of McCoys with interest especially the
part about Gen. Sternberg and the Reed
Board- I am so glad that both of
the statements were right- In Hug in Sept-
1898 I was not in Cuba and knew
nothing of what was happening there-
There was wrong going on in Jacksonville
Fla to keep me busy at that time-
div1.closer:
Yours Kean Thanks'
Missinteresting.
M W I
April 17 Apr. 18
